intro: Moldavica setosa, commonly known as the slender moldavica, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Moldavica setosa thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its ornamental value has made it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is not widely cultivated.
